metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3616 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
The cjpeg utility in libjpeg allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) or execute arbitrary code via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libturbojpeg - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libjpeg-progs - 1:9b-2
libjpeg9 - 1:9b-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only affects the cjpeg tool, which isn't shipped in libjpeg6b

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.1-0ubuntu1').
libjpeg9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9b-2').
